etymologies: 1960s; earliest use found in Journal of the American Medical Association. From med- (origin uncertain; perhaps from me- + -d- (in dihydro-)) + -azepam

definitions: A benzodiazepine, C₁₆ H₁₅ ClN₂, given orally (sometimes as the hydrochloride) as a mild tranquillizer in the treatment of anxiety-related conditions.
